WorkItem.Description:
Copy the default for a CalendarDayButton from generic.xaml. Locate the template, which contains a grid element. Set a margin on that grid element (so the days can be spaced further apart).
 
Switch to the  year or decade mode and observe the offset/shrunken grid.
 
It should be possible to modify the CalendarDayButton template without affecting the year or decade view.
 
This bug is also observed if items are placed into the template (a second grid with more rows/usercontrols/textblocks/etc.), causing the button to expand in any direction.
 
Note: For the attached screenshots the calendar control was placed in a Viewbox with Stretch set to Fill, however, the bug is visible without the use of a Viewbox.
WorkItem.Summary: Adding margin space to a CalendarDayButton template causes Year and Decade modes to shrink

Comments.Message: Unfortunately this is a byproduct of the fact that the buttons are reused for the different calendar modes.  You should be able to setup a Trigger that will turn on/off your margin based on the mode.

HI MBursill,

Thanks very much for reporting the issue.  Can you send your repro app so that we can investigate what you are doing and look at your template?  You can post here or attach these.

Thanks,
Alexis
